member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.CommonRegex
member.summary: This class contains some of the more common regular expressions to be used for redaction.
member.remarks: This class contains some of the more common regular expressions to be used for redaction. Most of these are copied verbatim from the "regular expression cookbook 2nd edition".

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.CompositeCleanupStrategy
member.summary: This class is a composite pattern for .
member.remarks: This class is a composite pattern for . It allows users to have multiple ICleanupStrategy implementations and bundle them as one.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.CompositeCleanupStrategy.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a composite pattern for cleanup strategies.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.CompositeCleanupStrategy.Add(iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.ICleanupStrategy)
member.summary: Adds a cleanup strategy to this composite pattern.
member.param: a cleanup strategy to be added to this composite pattern.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.CompositeCleanupStrategy.Reset
member.summary: Returns a cleanup strategy which represents a reset composite cleanup strategy.
member.remarks:
Returns a cleanup strategy which represents a reset composite cleanup strategy.
Note that all the inner strategies will be reset as well.
member.returns: a reset composite strategy

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.ICleanupStrategy
member.summary:
This class represents a generic cleanup strategy to be used with
or
ICleanupStrategy must implement Cloneable to ensure a strategy can be reset after having handled a page.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.Autosweep.ICleanupStrategy.Reset
member.summary: ICleanupStrategy objects have to be reset at times PdfAutoSweep will use the same strategy for all pages, and expects to receive only the rectangles from the last page as output.
member.remarks: ICleanupStrategy objects have to be reset at times PdfAutoSweep will use the same strategy for all pages, and expects to receive only the rectangles from the last page as output. Hence the reset method.
member.returns: a clone of this Object

member.summary: Check if page annotations will be processed.
member.remarks: Check if page annotations will be processed. Default: .
member.returns: if annotations will be processed by the

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.CleanUpProperties.SetProcessAnnotations(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set if page annotations will be processed.
member.remarks: Set if page annotations will be processed. Default processing behaviour: remove annotation if there is overlap with a redaction region.
member.param: is page annotations will be processed

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.CleanUpProperties.GetOverlapRatio
member.summary: Gets the overlap ratio.
member.remarks: Gets the overlap ratio. This is a value between 0 and 1 that indicates how much the content region should overlap with the redaction area to be removed.
member.returns:
the overlap ratio or
if it has not been set.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.CleanUpProperties.SetOverlapRatio(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Sets the overlap ratio.
member.remarks:
Sets the overlap ratio. This is a value between 0 and 1 that indicates how much the content region should overlap with the redaction area to be removed.
Example: if the overlap ratio is set to 0.3, the content region will be removed if it overlaps with the redaction area by at least 30%.
member.param: The overlap ratio to set.

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.Exceptions.CleanupExceptionMessageConstant
member.summary: Class that bundles all the error message templates as constants.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.FilteredImagesCache.Get(iText.PdfCleanup.FilteredImagesCache.FilteredImageKey)
member.summary: Retrieves saved result of image filtering based on given set of cleaning areas.
member.remarks:
Retrieves saved result of image filtering based on given set of cleaning areas. This won't handle the case when same filtering result is produced by different sets of areas, e.g. if one set is { (0, 0, 50, 100), (50, 0, 50, 100)} and another one is {(0, 0, 100, 100)}, even though filtering results are essentially the same, current
will treat this two cases as different filtering results.
member.param: the defining filtering case
member.returns: result of image filtering based on given set of cleaning areas if such was already processed and saved, null otherwise.

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern
member.summary: Represents the line dash pattern.
member.remarks: Represents the line dash pattern. The line dash pattern shall control the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths. It shall be specified by a dash array and a dash phase.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.#ctor(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfArray,System.Single)
member.summary:
Creates new
object.
member.param: The dash array. See
The dash phase. See

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.GetDashArray
member.summary: Getter for the dash array.
member.remarks:
Getter for the dash array.
The dash arrayâ€™s elements is number that specify the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps; the numbers are nonnegative. The elements are expressed in user space units.
member.returns: The dash array.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.SetDashArray(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfArray)
member.summary: Setter for the dash array.
member.remarks: Setter for the dash array. See
member.param: New dash array.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.GetDashPhase
member.summary: Getter for the dash phase.
member.remarks:
Getter for the dash phase.
The dash phase shall specify the distance into the dash pattern at which to start the dash. The elements are expressed in user space units.
member.returns: The dash phase.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.SetDashPhase(System.Single)
member.summary: Setter for the dash phase.
member.remarks: Setter for the dash phase. See
member.param: New dash phase.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.Next
member.summary: Calculates and returns the next element which is either gap or dash.
member.returns: The next dash array's element.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.Reset
member.summary:
Resets the dash array so that the
method will start from the beginning of the dash array.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.IsSolid
member.summary: Checks whether the dashed pattern is solid or not.
member.remarks: Checks whether the dashed pattern is solid or not. It's solid when the size of a dash array is even and sum of all the units off in the array is 0. For example: [3 0 4 0 5 0 6 0] (sum is 0), [3 0 4 0 5 1] (sum is 1).
member.returns: is the dashed pattern solid or not

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.LineDashPattern.IsEven(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return whether or not a given number is even
member.param: input number
member.returns: true if the input number is even, false otherwise

member.summary: Class representing a single element of a dash array

whether this element indicates a gap, or a stroke

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleaner
member.summary: Main entry point for cleaning a PDF document.
member.remarks:
Main entry point for cleaning a PDF document. This class contains a series of static methods that accept PDF file as a
or already opened
and performs erasing of data in regions specified by input arguments. The output can either be preserved in passed
with possibility to post-process the document, or in an
in a form of a complete PDF file.
The important difference between overloads with InputStream/OutputStream parameters and
parameter is in the consumption of product license limits.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleaner.CleanUp(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IList{iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpLocation})
member.summary: Cleans the document by erasing all the areas which are provided.
member.remarks: Cleans the document by erasing all the areas which are provided. Note, use methods with InputStream/OutputStream params if you don't want to consume itext-core product license limits.
member.param: the pdf document InputStream to which cleaned up applies
the cleaned up pdf document OutputStream
list of locations to be cleaned up

member.remarks: Cleans the document by erasing regions defined by redact annotations and additional cleanup locations inside the document. Note, use methods with InputStream/OutputStream params if you don't want to consume itext-core product license limits.

the cleaned up pdf document OutputStream
list of locations to be cleaned up

member.summary: Return true if two given rectangles (specified by an array of points) intersect.
member.param: the first rectangle, considered as a subject of intersection. Even if it's width is zero, it still can be intersected by second rectangle.

member.summary: Checks if the input intersection rectangle is degenerate.
member.remarks: Checks if the input intersection rectangle is degenerate. In case of intersection subject is degenerate (isIntersectSubjectDegenerate is true) and it is included into intersecting rectangle, this method returns false, despite of the intersection rectangle is degenerate.
member.param: intersection rectangle
value, specifying if the intersection subject is degenerate.
member.returns: true - if the intersection rectangle is degenerate.

member.summary: Converts specified degenerate subpaths to circles.
member.remarks: Converts specified degenerate subpaths to circles. Note: actually the resultant subpaths are not real circles but approximated.
member.param: Radius of each constructed circle.
member.returns: consisting of circles constructed on given degenerated subpaths.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpFilter.ConvertToSquares(System.Collections.Generic.IList{iText.Kernel.Geom.Subpath},System.Double,iText.Kernel.Geom.Path)
member.summary: Converts specified degenerate subpaths to squares.
member.remarks: Converts specified degenerate subpaths to squares. Note: the list of degenerate subpaths should contain at least 2 elements. Otherwise we can't determine the direction which the rotation of each square depends on.
member.param: Width of each constructed square.
The path which dash pattern applied to. Needed to calc rotation angle of each square.
member.returns: consisting of squares constructed on given degenerated subpaths.

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpProcessor.QuadPointsForLinkAnnotationAreValid(iText.Kernel.Geom.Rectangle,iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfArray)
member.summary: For a link annotation, a quadpoints array can be specified but it will be ignored in favour of the rectangle if one of the points is located outside the rectangle's boundaries
member.param: rectangle entry of the link annotation
An array of 8 Ã— n numbers specifying the coordinates of n quadrilaterals in default user space that comprise the region in which the link should be activated.
member.returns: true if the quad points are valid, false if the quadpoint array should be used

member.name: M:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpProcessor.PollNotAppliedCtm
member.summary: To add images and formXObjects to canvas we pass ctm.
member.remarks: To add images and formXObjects to canvas we pass ctm. Here we try to find last not applied ctm in order to pass it to PdfCanvas method later. Returned ctm is written right before the image, that's why we care only for not applied ctms of the current (the "deepest") q/Q nesting level. If such ctm wasn't found identity ctm is returned.

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpProcessor.NotAppliedGsParams
member.summary: Single instance of this class represents not applied graphics state params of the single q/Q nesting level.
member.remarks:
Single instance of this class represents not applied graphics state params of the single q/Q nesting level. For example:
0 g 1 0 0 1 25 50 cm
q
5 w /Gs1 gs 13 g
Q
1 0 0 RG
Operators "0 g", "1 0 0 1 25 50 cm" and "1 0 0 RG" belong to the outer q/Q nesting level; Operators "5 w", "/Gs1 gs", "13 g" belong to the inner q/Q nesting level. Operators of every level of the q/Q nesting are stored in different instances of this class.

member.name: T:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpTool
member.summary: Represents the main mechanism for cleaning a PDF document.

member.name: F:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpTool.floatMultiplier
member.summary: When a document with line arts is being cleaned up, there are a lot of calculations with floating point numbers.
member.remarks: When a document with line arts is being cleaned up, there are a lot of calculations with floating point numbers. All of them are translated into fixed point numbers by multiplying by this coefficient. Vary it to adjust the preciseness of the calculations.

member.name: F:iText.PdfCleanup.PdfCleanUpTool.arcTolerance
member.summary: Used as the criterion of a good approximation of rounded line joins and line caps.

object. If
is true, regions to be erased are extracted from the redact annotations contained inside the given document. Those redact annotations will be removed from the resultant document. If
is false, then no regions for erasing are specified. In that case use
method to set regions to be erased from the document.

if true - regions to be erased are extracted from the redact annotations contained
